definition: a breed of horse/variant of 歡|欢[huan1]

sentences.english: All sounds are still only moments, the mood will be cheerful jump.
sentences.chinese: 只有万籁俱静的时刻，心绪才会欢快的跳跃。

sentences.english: Jubilantly they field into the classroom. The professor passedoutthe papers.
sentences.chinese: 他们欢快地进了考场，教授把考卷发给他们。

sentences.english: The cheerful song full of the whole classroom.
sentences.chinese: 欢快的歌声充满了整间教室。

sentences.english: Tail is docked and well set on, carried gaily but never over the back.
sentences.chinese: 断尾，欢快地举着，但决不能翻卷在背上。

sentences.english: Her hands delighted in the thick hair that covered his chest.
sentences.chinese: 她的手在他浓厚的胸毛里欢快得很。

sentences.english: The sun never sang to me so bright.
sentences.chinese: 阳光也对我歌唱，从未如此的欢快。

sentences.english: My dog is my perfect companion.
sentences.chinese: 我的可卡是只欢快的小狗。

sentences.english: Summer Wind also added a little power, it is more merry dance of the.
sentences.chinese: 夏日的风又加了一点力量，它舞得更欢快了。

sentences.english: The happy little dog jumped all over him in his joy.
sentences.chinese: 小狗欢快的扑到他身上。

sentences.english: The yellow dog at home is coming up and gaily around three people jump.
sentences.chinese: 家中的大黄迎上来，欢快地绕着仨人跳跃。

sentences.english: Cheerful expression goatherd lifelike, seem to be specially to welcome us.
sentences.chinese: 牧童欢快的表情栩栩如生，好象是特意来欢迎我们的。

sentences.english: Emotional and transparent image of mountain streams uncontaminated streams, lively and smooth.
sentences.chinese: 情绪透明的的像山涧中未经污染的小溪，欢快而流畅。

sentences.english: During the break, the sportsground rang with happy shouts.
sentences.chinese: 课间休息时，操场上回响着欢快的叫声。

sentences.english: Cheerfulness and goodwill make labour light.
sentences.chinese: 欢快与好意，劳动不觉累。

sentences.english: A cheerful sunlight penetrated the freshly unfolded and luminous leaves.
sentences.chinese: 一道欢快的阳光正穿过那些通明透亮的新发的树叶。
孩子们在欢快地齐声唱歌。

definition: high-pitched and penetrating (musical instrument, voice etc)/high-spirited/fever-pitched (atmosphere)
